intro: Hyptis carvalhoi, commonly known as Brazilian hyptis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural use.
